author: pmcgoohan
content: I totally agree that centralized block builders are a huge threat and I've been ringing the alarm on this for more than a year. I don't see that randomly selected keypers are though. How is this any different from say randomly selected committees in PoS? Crucially, tx encryption means that even if a builder centralizes, they can cause less user harm with toxic MEV and less network harm because they can't meaningfully censor txs (it's all or nothing)
